title: Strength of Association Spectrum
description: An interactive MicroSim that helps students classify associations between categorical variables as strong, moderate, weak, or none by visualizing two-way tables, segmented bar charts, and a strength meter.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Statistics
Data Analysis
Categorical Data
learningObjectives: Classify associations as strong, moderate, weak, or none
Interpret two-way tables to identify patterns
Read segmented bar charts to compare conditional distributions
Understand that equal conditional distributions indicate independence
prerequisites: Basic knowledge of percentages and proportions

controls.name: strengthSlider
controls.label: Strength
controls.description: Adjusts the strength of association from 0% (none) to 100% (perfect)

controls.name: presetButtons
controls.description: Quick access to common association strength levels

variables.name: tableData
variables.description: 2x2 contingency table counts based on association strength

assumptions: Each treatment group has exactly 100 observations
Base success rate is 50% when there is no association
Association is modeled as symmetric deviation from base rate
limitations: Does not include statistical significance testing
Perfect association is presented as achievable for illustration purposes

accessibility.describe: Interactive visualization showing the spectrum of association strength from none to perfect. Students can adjust a slider or select presets to see how two-way tables and segmented bar charts change, learning to classify associations by strength.
